thread.title: Esler TDs not enough for Crocus to get past host Giants
thread.title_full: Esler TDs not enough for Crocus to get past host Giants

title: Esler TDs not enough for Crocus to get past host Giants
text:
Esler TDs not enough for Crocus to get past host Giants By: Uncredited Report Error 
The Crocus Plainsmen came up just short of their second win of the Winnipeg High School Football League season on Friday. 
Sam Esler ran for a pair of touchdowns, but it wasn’t enough to push his team over the top as the Plainsmen (1-5) fell 21-18 to the Elmwood Giants (5-1) in their Kas Vidruk (AA) Division game at Investors Group Field in Winnipeg. 
Both of Esler’s scoring runs were from two yards out. Esler, the Crocus quarterback, finished with 36 yards on the ground and was 13-for-20 passing for 130 yards and two interceptions. 
“The kids played their asses off. I was very proud of them,” said Crocus head coach Kevin Boyd. 
Reilly Keele added 54 rushing yards to the Plainsmen attack, while Bryce Parnetta caught five passes for 68 yards. 
Cole Kardash made six tackles on defence and also forced a safety touch on special teams. 
Steven Butson added three tackles and a sack for Crocus, while Cordell Chartrand made four tackles. 
Mike Olive kicked a 27-yard field goal and a convert to round out the scoring for Crocus. 
The Plainsmen close out the regular season on Thursday when they host the Kildonan East Reivers.
